**Blue dragon scale mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Blue dragon scale mail is not randomly generated. Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [blue dragon scales](/wiki/Blue_dragon_scales "Blue dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") blue dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, blue dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing blue dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [blue dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage. Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide extrinsic [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

Blue dragon scale mail is rarely used by most characters, since [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") can protect a character against the [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning") and the [lightning](/wiki/Lightning_\(monster_spell\) "Lightning (monster spell)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), and ranged attacks or another source of shock resistance can help avoid or protect from many other types of shock damage. [Puddings](/wiki/Pudding "Pudding") and [gelatinous cubes](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") in particular may confer shock resistance to a character before they meet a monster that deals non-reflectable shock damage, and other sources of the property (e.g. the [ring of shock resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance "Ring of shock resistance")) will often be encountered before blue dragons or their scales.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Blue dragon scale mail is much more likely to be considered for characters since it confers extrinsic speed and shock resistance: they both gain a valuable source of shock damage protection for their inventory, especially against revamped [shocking spheres](/wiki/Shocking_sphere "Shocking sphere"), while also potentially freeing up their [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") slot for other options; blue dragon mail may be the best option for certain builds that do not use body armor for reflection or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and/or are not as concerned about [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation").

## History

Blue dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, blue dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a blue dragon. Blue dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give blue dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of blue dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make blue dragon mail and other colors more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [gnoll chieftains](/wiki/Gnoll_chieftain "Gnoll chieftain") have a 1⁄10 chance of generating with blue dragon scale mail.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn blue dragon scale mail additionally confers extrinsic speed.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") can create dragon scale mail directly.

Blue dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **electric dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn blue dragon scale mail additionally confers speed.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn blue dragon scale mail additionally confers extrinsic speed and [protects against sources of slowing](/index.php?title=Slowing_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slowing resistance (page does not exist)"). It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 156](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L156): *initial body armor for Astral playermons is random DSM, with equal probability*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 518](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L518)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 705](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line705 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")

Main article: Dragon scale mail
